node.title: Booby traps and mantraps: Gisborne police issue warning after discovering large cannabis crop
node.description: "If anyone comes across what looks like a cannabis growing set-up to be especially mindful."
node.content: ["Tairawhiti police are warning Kiwis to be careful after discovering a large crop of cannabis plants and growing equipment near Wharerata Forest.", "The stash of plants and equipment was located on Paritu Road and seized by police on Monday.\u00a0", "Police are asking anyone with information about suspicious activity in the area to come forward.\u00a0", "Police said the discovery is a timely reminder to be aware cannabis growers are more active in the summer season.\u00a0", "\"These individuals like to trespass into suitable locations to plant their cannabis crops,\" police warned.\u00a0", "\"Police also would like to warn the community that if anyone comes across what looks like a cannabis growing set-up to be especially mindful of booby traps and other mantraps designed to cause harm to those that would potentially interfere with their crops.", "\"If you find a cannabis grow or think that one may be operating near you call Police on 111 or anonymously through Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.\"\u00a0"]
